sections.heading: Short title.
sections.text:
This Act may be cited as the
Surgical Institute for Children Act.

sections.heading: There is hereby authorized to be established a
sections.text:
surgical institute in and for the State of Illinois for the surgical
treatment of children under the age of sixteen years, suffering from
physical deformities or injuries of a nature which will likely yield to
surgical skill and treatment and which unless so treated will probably make
such children, in whole or in part, in after life, public charges.

sections.heading: Said institute shall be known as the Illinois Surgical Institute
sections.text:
for Children; and by such name shall be and constitute a corporation, under
the laws of the State of Illinois.

sections.heading: The purpose and object of said institute shall be to receive, treat
sections.text:
and nurse such children whose parents or guardians may be financially
unable to provide surgical treatment, as may be physically deformed, or
suffering from injuries requiring surgical treatment, to the end that their
physical disabilities may be removed, and that they may be thereby made
able to become self-sustaining, instead of being or becoming, at some
future time, public charges.

sections.heading: The management and control of said institution shall be vested in
sections.text: the Board of Trustees of the University of Illinois.

sections.heading: Any child under the age of 16 years whose parents, or natural guardian,
sections.text:
may be unable to furnish proper surgical treatment and who may be in need
of the same, may be admitted to such institute, upon an order to that
effect made by the circuit judge residing in the county in which the child
may have had a legal residence for one year last past. The county treasurer
of the county in which the child may have so resided shall, upon the order
of the judge, furnish such child with transportation from the place where
he may so reside to the place of such institution and return. The order
admitting such child shall, when made, be filed with the superintendent of
the institute, and the child shall be admitted thereto in the regular order
of filing as soon thereafter as the institute can provide room, care and
attendance therefor. The child, if deemed feasible, shall be treated,
nursed in the institute, until a recovery is effected, or it becomes
apparent that further treatment will be of no avail, whereupon he shall be
discharged and returned to his former place of residence.

sections.heading: Said institution shall be located in that portion of Illinois which
The Board of Trustees of the University of Illinois shall appoint a
sections.text:
skilled and capable surgeon, general superintendent, and may remove him for
cause stated, first having given him a copy of the charges against him, and
reasonable notice of the time and place when such charges will be heard,
and an opportunity to defend himself.

sections.heading: The Board of Trustees of the University of Illinois may, from time
sections.text:
to time, accept, hold and use for the benefit of the institution, or the
inmates thereof, any gift, donation or legacy
of money, or real or
personal property, and may agree to and perform any condition of such gift,
donation or legacy not contrary to law.

sections.heading: The Board of Trustees of the University of Illinois shall establish
sections.text:
all needful rules and regulations for the management of said institution
and the inmates thereof.
